results.title: Gippsland: Through the forest
results.brief_description: Provides a look at the life forms of the Gippsland forest area. Here the world’s tallest hardwood tree, the mountain ash, towers to a height of one hundred metres or more and provides food and shelter at all levels, from the forest floor where the lyrebird scavengers to the tree tops which provide launching pads for the spectacular sugar gliders. Shows also the impact of the area’s two enemies: fire and man, and shows a rare glimpse of the family life of Australia’s laughing bird, the kookaburra.

results.title: Gippsland: the high country
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Part of “The World we share” series. Provides an exploration of the mountains in Gippsland through the changing seasons. Shows how the long winter surprisingly sustains a complex network of life underneath the snow. The brief spring and summer bring a rush of life witnessed in the vocal battle of frogs over territory, the birth of a butterfly, the migration of cockatoos and the life style of the burramy. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Gippsland: open to the sea
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Part of “The World we share” series. Provides a study of life that abounds in the lake area in Gippsland. Shows the microscopic life in the waters of the lakes. Also notes the animals and birds that inhabit the shores such as the sea eagles that fish the lakes and the ant lion and the digger wasp that make their homes in the lake’s sandy shores. The mysterious moss ball swamps near the lakes are also looked at. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Gippsland: Down river
results.brief_description: Shows how the floods that bring disaster to man in the Gippsland area play a key area play a key role in the natural cycle of the plant and animal life to be found there. However in the remote swamps and wetlands of the area, the cycle is threatened by man’s activities further upstream.

results.title: Gippsland Honeymoon
results.brief_description:
A honeymoon couple tour the Gippsland area and admire the scenic attractions of the country-side. Depicts many of Victoria’s famous tourist attractions including: Lakes Entrance, Gippsland, Orbost, the Snowy River, the Tambo River, Bairnsdale, Omeo, Walhalla Goldfields, Buchan Caves, Mallacoota Inlet, La Trobe Valley, Glen Maggie Weir and Ninety Mile Beach. Produced in conjunction with The Tourist Development Authority and The Gippsland Lakes and Tourist Promotion Council.

This film was discussed on ABC Gippsland Radio on 14 March 2020. The following are comments for viewers which add insight into the film

Martin Richardson “Joe” is Joe Southon, from Paynesville who wasn’t actually a Lakes Entrance fisherman, but was the chosen “talent” for the movie - it was through his connections that the film crew came down here to make the movie. He was a farmer, part-time fisherman, and farm manager whose property occupied a large part of what is now the town of Paynesville. He was also involved in many civic roles around the Bairnsdale Shire. His daughter Beryl and son Bluey still live in Paynesville.

Ashley Meek My father features on this add fishing at the Glenmaggie spillway

Neil Walters who picked up one of the narrators was Ross Higgins. “put the money on the fridge wog.!” (Kingswood Country)

Graeme Nixon Cape Conran my dad jim nixon boat and me. Front boat

results.title: Giovanni Pastrone
results.brief_description: Giovanni Pastrone was a director, producer, actor and inventor who pioneered the use of diffused lighting, panoramas, grandiose sets, miniature models and a moving camera. All of these elements were on show in his epic 1914 film, Cabiria.

constellations_primary.name: Tracking cinema
constellations_primary.description: A constellation looking at the evolution of the tracking / dolly shot.

results.description: Giovanni Pastrone was a director, producer, actor and inventor who pioneered the use of diffused lighting, panoramas, grandiose sets, miniature models and a moving camera. All of these elements were on show in his epic 1914 film, Cabiria. The film broke new artistic ground by using special effects to re-create the eruption of Mount Etna and the naval battle of Syracuse, but its biggest legacy is the ‘Cabiria’ shot: the tracking shot. Pastrone mounted a camera on a dolly to trail the action in a scene, and this new technique was quickly adopted by filmmakers at the time.
description_for_label: Giovanni Pastrone was a director, producer, actor and inventor who pioneered the use of diffused lighting, panoramas, grandiose sets, miniature models and a moving camera. All of these elements were on show in his epic 1914 film, Cabiria. The film broke new artistic ground by using special effects to re-create the eruption of Mount Etna and the naval battle of Syracuse, but its biggest legacy is the ‘Cabiria’ shot: the tracking shot. Pastrone mounted a camera on a dolly to trail the action in a scene, and this new technique was quickly adopted by filmmakers at the time.

results.title: Giorgio Armani: Calvin Klein
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Reeder, Marlene McGinnis Cardin and Videofashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Designers”.
A fascinating documentary focusing on two of fashions most sought-after designers. Giorgio Armani is regarded as one of fashion’s master tailors, and was also one of the first designers to actively seek patronage from Hollywood, coming to prominence after Richard Gere wore an Armani blazer in the film American Gigolo. As a result, the name Armani is synonymous with wealth, elegance and prestige. Calvin Klein, on the other hand, is more famous as a brand name and an image. Klein became a household name after launching a brand of designer jeans, with a controversial advertising campaign featuring a young Brooke Shields. His simple yet appealing designs and lack of interest in adopting seasonal trends have helped him to build a successful billion dollar business.
